text:
Yesterday betfair closed my account without explanation, and I asked customer support what was going on and whether they could reopen my account.

Today I got an email from <mailto:escalations@betfair.com|escalations@betfair.com>, and they said that my account would remain closed, again without providing any explanation. I have never tried to abuse the exchange. I have been betting and generating commission and my account had nice lifetime profit but I didn’t have an account manager yet. I am at a total loss. This wonderful hobby is suddenly gone. They won’t allow me to bet anymore. I have no idea what to do now. <!channel> any advice would be greatly appreciated.

They won’t even allow me to withdraw my funds…

elements.text:

I have been betting and generating commission and my account had nice lifetime profit but I didn’t have an account manager yet. I am at a total loss. This wonderful hobby is suddenly gone. They won’t allow me to bet anymore. I have no idea what to do now.

any advice would be greatly appreciated.

They won’t even allow me to withdraw my funds…

text: Normally I don't post here but this is quite interesting (and scary) as I've had an active  BF account since BF started as a business.  I was at first thinking it was a sportsbook related thing, but they would only throttle your bets if winning to much. If you're not using a VPN outside of the UK as you say you're not and your not breaking any of T&C knowingly then this is very strange. To go straight to account closure is quite unusual indeed because normally they would suspend an account pending an investigation. There is something very wrong here either with what you are claiming or what they perceive is happening so you really need to contact BF again and keep trying.  My personal interest is that I'm about to start using a bot for betting and noticing your high amount of betting activity I also don't want to go foul for something wrong unknowing. In that regard I hope you share if possible what the problem is when you find out.

attachments.text: Hi, when downloading historical data, we are provided with some information about the event (event_id, event_name, date). text: <@UU1URJ8L8> I am not sure of the situation in NL but in UK and AUS there are governing bodies you can go to and raise a complaint and ask for feedback and a ruling.  Sometimes you won’t get explanation on why your account has been closed as it has been identified as fraudulent activity or for money laundering.  Ie basically criminal activity.  If you get flagged for this they are not allow to say why your account was closed. BTW I’m not saying you are doing these things but they have patterns they do look for to identify this activity and it could incorrectly flag your account. The ones I have read about are names not matching on Betfair account to bank account, and another one is constantly depositing and withdrawing the whole amount of funds (or a significant portion). It sounds like in your situation you will hitting lots of markets with < 2 pound bets and you were not generating enough commission to cover the cost of letting you use the API. If it was a suspected premium charge avoidance you would have been told. I am assuming the cause is too much activity on the API without enough commission generated over an extended period of time. I am assuming this as you were doing thousands of bets per day but you were yet to have enough commission to have an account manager.
